intro: Raphionacme sudanica, commonly known as Sudanese raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often with vibrant colors attracting pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
